Function to calculate soil temperature.

Source: R/TsoilFunctions.R
soil_temperature_function.Rd

Function called to calculate soil temperature from Beckman et al. (1973, Thermal Model for Prediction of a Desert Iguana's Daily and Seasonal Behavior). Parameters are passed as a list to facilitating solving the equations. This function is not intended to be called directly.

soil_temperature_function(j, T_so, params)

Arguments

j

is the number of the iteration of running the model
T_so

is the initial soil temperature profile in degrees C
params

is a list containing the following parameters, which are described below: list(SSA, epsilon_so, sigma, k_so, c_so, dz, k, z_r, z0, H, T_a, u, rho_a, rho_so, c_a, TimeIn,dt,shade).
SSA

is the solar absorbtivity of soil surface as a fraction
epsilon_so

is the thermal absorbtivity of soil surface as a fraction
k_so

is soil thermal conductivity in W m^-1 K^-1
c_so

is the soil specific heat capacity in in J kg^-1 K-1.
dz

is the vertical interval in m for the soil temperature profile
z_r

is reference height in m
z0

is surface roughness in m
H

is solar radiation in W m^-2
T_a

is air temperature in degrees C
u

is wind speed (m/s)
rho_a

is the density of air (kg/m^3)
rho_so

particle density of soil
c_a

is the specific heat of air (J/(kg*K))
TimeIn

is a vector of time periods for the model
dt=

60*60 is the time interval for running the model
shade

is whether or not soil temperature should be calculated in the shade, TRUE or FALSE

Value

soil temperature function

Details

Function to calculate soil temperature.

See also

Other soil temperature functions: soil_conductivity, soil_specific_heat, soil_temperature_equation, soil_temperature_integrand, soil_temperature

Examples

if (FALSE) {
temp_vector= runif(96, min=-10, max=10)
wind_speed_vector= runif(96, min=0, max=0.4)
time_vector= rep(1:24,4)
solrad_vector= rep(c(rep(0,6),seq(10,700,length.out=6), seq(700,10,length.out=6),rep(0,6)),4)

params=list(SSA=0.7, epsilon_so=0.98, k_so=0.293, c_so=800, dz=0.05, z_r=1.5, z0=0.02, H=solrad_vector, T_a=temp_vector, u=wind_speed_vector, rho_a=1.177,rho_so=1620, c_a=1006, TimeIn=time_vector, dt=60*60, shade=FALSE)

soil_temperature_function(j=1,T_so= rep(20,13), params=params)

}
